alert.note: Alert for Powder River (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Powder River County officials report ice jams along the Powder River. One is about 5 to 9 miles south of Broadus and is nearly 10 miles long causing water to back up and flood nearby locations. Another is just north of Broadus causing water levels to rise with flooding expected in the Broadus vicinity. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by ice jams is occurring. * WHERE...Along the Powder River in southeast Montana, including the following county, Powder River. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of areas along and near the Powder River as water backs up behind ice jams. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water downstream, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM MDT, Powder River County officials have reported flooding in the the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Broadus, and areas up to 10 miles south of Broadus along the Powder River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Stay away or be swept away. River banks can become unstable and unsafe. Move livestock and farm equipment to safe locations.
